talks.title: Formalising Subject Reduction and Progress for Multiparty Session Processes
talks.venue: International Conference on Interactive Theorem Proving (ITP)
talks.abstract: Multiparty session types (MPST) provide a robust typing discipline for specifying and verifying communication protocols in concurrent and distributed systems involving multiple participants. This work formalises the non-stuck theorem for synchronous MPST in the Coq proof assistant, ensuring that well-typed communications never get stuck.

talks.title: Introduction to Algebraic Number Theory
talks.abstract: An introduction to the fundamental concepts of algebraic number theory, covering number fields, rings of integers, and the relationship between algebraic and analytic number theory.

talks.title: Coinductive Reasoning in Type Theory
talks.abstract: Exploring the use of coinductive reasoning in dependent type theory, with applications to infinite data structures and program verification.
